After playing with the visor I will never go back to a cage. It was probably because my cage and helmet were so poorly fitted before but I don't lose sight of the puck anymore.

Thank you. It was very hard but I'm so glad I played. I love this game.

That's amazing! It truly is, keep up the good work.

The pain I get is from the rubbing. When I first put the skates on, walk out to the ice and skate for a bit there's no pain. But after skating for a while I start to feel it rubbing. The blisters are on the inside of my feet, right below the ankle. I don't feel my foot moving but it definitely is if I'm getting blisters like these. Is it possible that I'm tying my skates too tight?

WRITING.TITLE: Breaking in Bauer Skates
WRITING.TEXT: First post on here! So after having CCM Vector 6.0 for the past 10 years I decided it was time to get new skates. I went to Hockey Giant and decided on Bauer Vapor X500. Skates felt good in store, got my feet measured to make sure I got the right fit and I got them baked also. Today I played open hockey with them for about 2 hours, I could feel the blisters forming. I have 2 pretty decent sized blisters in the same exact spot on the inside of both of my feet. Since they're blistering in the same spot I'm hoping I just need to skate with them more to break them in. Any ideas?
jock socks skates shin gaurds girdle shoulders elbows

WRITING.TITLE: Bad MOBO?
WRITING.TEXT: Woke up this morning and tried to turn on my PC just to find out I'm getting no power. PSU doesn't kick on, no fans, nothing. At first I thought it was the PSU until I took it out and tested it. First I jumped the green and a black wire and the fan kicked on. I then tested each lead coming off the 24 pin connector and my molex connectors and all the voltages were correct I hooked up my case fans to the PSU and they all started up fine. I think I've narrowed it down to the MOBO but I've never heard of a motherboard just dying like that which has me second guessing myself. Any thoughts would be extremely appreciated!
Regular A40s
I also have mine plugged into the USB port of my PC and I've never had a problem with the chat mixer.

The wendler I follow is a 5-3-1. Meaning you take percentages of your max and use those each week with a different rep scheme. First week is 3 sets of 5 of gradually increasing weight. The 2nd will be 3 sets of 3 with slightly heavier weights gradually increasing and then your final week would be 1 set of 5, 1 set of 3 and then your very last would be an AMRAP (The last set of every lift will be an AMRAP). You can use that system for your bench, squat, dead and OHP. After each of your main lifts you'll do accessory movements. For example, after squatting you can do RDL's and Bulgarian split squats. I do back, chest and shoulders the same day after my OHP. Considering you have shoulder problems, and I'm not a PT, I don't want to suggest anything as far as your shoulder days go. As for your core you are correct, doing things like reverse kettle bell crunches, barbell rollouts and pallof presses are just a few. Core strength is what is going to make all your lifts go up. Just sharing what has been successful for me!

I would look into a wendler program. As a beginner, I think you should seperate your squat and dead. Your bench, squat and dead are very important. I would really focus on building up your base strength and really improve your main lifts. Don't forget about core either! Good luck!

None taken. New to Reddit. I have been seeing a lot of people bashing their customer service, which surprised me. I don't post much on here but the way they handled my situation was great, so I felt like I should share.

WRITING.TITLE: DXRacer has the best customer service!
WRITING.TEXT: So recently I posted in this subreddit that my chair was having problems with the lift piston. I got an immediate response from an employee of DXRacer giving me the email I needed to contact for the warranty (also I didn't even by this chair directly from dxracer). After sending the pictures of the defect that they needed they shipped me a new piston assembly immediately. Upon receiving the new piston I couldn't remove the old one from the wheel base. So I emailed them again and without any questions they sent out a new wheel base immediately! DXRacer gave me one of the best customer experiences I've ever had!
Just got my replacement in today and I'm curious also.

I actually ordered my chair from the same distributor. I contacted DxRacer first and they referred me to echoshen88@hotmail.com who handles all the 3rd party stuff. My lift piston slipped low into the wheel base and needed to be replaced. I just had to send in my name, order number and pictures of my lift piston and they shipped one out to me the same day free of charge.
Okay, thank you!
[A different view](http://i.imgur.com/YSUmdDl.jpg)
[Here's a picture](http://imgur.com/l7ccIZc) It's not dragging too bad but I feel like it shouldn't drag at all.

Hamilton!

Like everyone else is saying, work on your flexibility and core strength. It looks like you're comfortable in a low bar squat. A slight lean forward in a low bar squat is okay but you're leaning way too forward. No doubt your legs can handle the weight, it's just your flexibility and core strength holding you back. Try doing barbell rollouts and reverse kettle bell crunches to strengthen your core.
Or a muscle imbalance, strong glutes and hams and weak quads. Like I said, hard to tell without a video.
Hard to tell without a video.
Sounds like your core is weak.
